subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: Do not confuse {{lang|mul|月}} with {{m|mul|⺼|sc=Hani}}, a form of {{m|mul|肉||flesh, meat}} when used as the left-hand radical of a character. {{m|mul|⺼|sc=Hani}} is used for parts of the body such as {{m|mul|背||back}} or {{m|mul|肝||liver}}. These may be written identically as {{lang|mul|月}}, but in careful use they are distinguished, with the inside of {{lang|mul|⺼|sc=Hani}} being written with unattached diagonal strokes. This is particularly an issue in looking up characters by radical; compare the [[Index:Chinese radical/月|月 index]] and [[Index:Chinese radical/肉|肉 index]].

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – pictographic representation of a [[crescent moon]].

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{unk|zh}}. {{zh-ref|Unger (1992)}} proposes as cognates {{cog|bo|ངོ||waxing and waning moon; half moon}} (e.g. {{m|bo|མར་ངོ||waning moon}} and {{m|bo|ཡར་ངོ||waxing moon}}). Also compare {{cog|sit-pro|*s-ŋow||white; light colour}}.

{{zh-ref|Matisoff}} sets up {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-ŋʷ(j)a-t||moon; star}} for this, whence also {{w|Magar}} {{m|und||tr=gya hot|t=moon}}.

{{cog|th|งวด||occasion; time; period}} may be a Chinese loan ({{zh-ref|Manomaivibool, 1975}}).

subSections.title: Compounds
Etymology 1
Noun
Derived terms
Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|月よ星よ|つき よ ほし よ}}

subSections.title: Proverbs
Etymology 2
Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: The first sense is not productive in modern Japanese and not found in isolation.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 3
Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanyo|がつ}}
* Some dictionaries apparently classify this reading as both ''{{ll|ja|呉音|goon}}'' and ''{{ll|ja|慣用音|kan'yōon}}''.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Usage notes
subSections.text: When used in most compounds or when counting a number of months with {{m|ja|ヶ|tr=ka}}, 月 is pronounced {{ja-r|げつ}}. When used in compounds for modern months of the year, it is pronounced {{ja-r|がつ}}. When used for poetic or lunar months, it is pronounced {{ja-r|つき}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 4
Counter
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|げつ}}

# {{short for|lang=ja|[[月曜]], [[月曜日]]|tr=getsuyō, getsuyōbi|nodot=1sort=けつ'}}: [[Monday]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: When used in most compounds or when counting a number of months with {{m|ja|ヶ|tr=ka}}, 月 is pronounced {{ja-r|げつ}}. When used in compounds for modern months of the year, it is pronounced {{ja-r|がつ}}. When used for poetic or lunar months, it is pronounced {{ja-r|つき}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 5
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|がち|hhira=ぐわち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かち'|historical}} during the {{w|Edo period}}, a low [[rank]] of low-end [[prostitute]] in the {{w|Kansai}} region

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|月の女郎|がち の じょろう}}

subSections.title: Etymology 6
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=goon|がち}}

Either a shift in sense from the ''low-ranking prostitute'' meaning above, or a shift in [[pronunciation]] from {{m|ja|頑痴||tr=ganchi|[[stubborn]] and [[stupid]]}}.<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="KDJ"/>

subSections.title: Noun
